input: well u said that if it takes 6 months to get up to speed  then that would be middle of 2023. that relies on an assumption that the birds are being hatched now and will be laying six months from now. i said they were hatched 6 months ago  which means they start laying now. in reality  they are constantly being hatched  so new birds are aging into egg laying every month  which would also mean egg production would start to go up in 2023. if you want to completely change your point to make yourself feel better go for it  but i responded to your comment as it was. as far as your new comment  incorrect. the bird flu travels through a region. once it passes through via migratory birds  the chickens either catch it or don’t  and infected birds and those around them are culled in that period of time. so if bird flu swept through a farm in spring  they cull their flock and start over which is just about 7 months ago. their birds are just now starting to lay. avian flu has not hit my area  for example  so my chickens are still safe  but if i did have to cull my flock  the flu will have passed by the time i’m starting again and my new birds would lay 6ish months from now. hope that clears up the confusion for u.
